newsitem.title: USA: Control Data to sell Metaphase stake to partner.
newsitem.headline: Control Data to sell Metaphase stake to partner.

text.p: Control Data Systems Inc. has a definitive agreement to sell its 50 percent stake in Metaphase to joint venture partner Structural Dynamics Research Corp. for $31 million, the companies said Monday.
Metaphase, formed in 1992, develops software to manage engineering data during the design and manufacturing of a product.
The transaction consists of cash and a warrant to purchase Structural Dynamics stock.
The two companies in October ended talks on the possible creation of a single organisation to manage sales, service and develop product data software.

Control Data, based in Arden Hills, Minn., said the sale allows it to focus on software that helps organisations integrate systems required to create, transmit, access and control electronic information.

Milford, Ohio-based Structural Dynamics supplies mechanical design automation and product data management software. It has more than 1,500 employees and 59 offices in 13 countries in North America, Europe and the Asia/Pacific region.
Structural Dynamics' stock edged up 12.5 cents to $19.25, while Control Data rose $1.125 to $21.125 on Nasdaq.
